intro: Ixora granulata, commonly known as the granulated ixora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, granular texture on its leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright orange or red flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Ixora granulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and compact growth habit.
